questions.question_text: What is the primary goal of software engineering?
questions.explanation: Software engineering applies systematic, disciplined approaches to develop reliable and efficient software.

questions.question_text: Which model follows a sequential approach in software development?
questions.explanation: The Waterfall Model follows a linear, sequential approach where each phase is completed before the next begins.

questions.question_text: What is a use case in software engineering?
options: A description of system interactions with users
questions.correct_answer: A description of system interactions with users
questions.explanation: A use case describes how a user interacts with a system to achieve a specific goal.

questions.question_text: What does UML stand for?
questions.explanation: UML is a standardized modeling language used to visualize and document software system designs.

questions.question_text: Which testing verifies individual components of a system?
questions.explanation: Unit Testing verifies the functionality of individual components or modules in isolation.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a software requirements specification (SRS)?
options: To document user and system requirements
questions.correct_answer: To document user and system requirements
questions.explanation: An SRS outlines the functional and non-functional requirements of a software system.

questions.question_text: Which phase of the SDLC involves coding the software?
questions.explanation: The Implementation phase involves writing and compiling the code based on the design specifications.

questions.question_text: What is a key characteristic of the Agile methodology?
questions.explanation: Agile emphasizes iterative development with frequent feedback and adaptability to changes.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a class diagram in UML?
options: To model static structure of classes
questions.correct_answer: To model static structure of classes
questions.explanation: A class diagram shows the classes, their attributes, and relationships in a system.

questions.question_text: What does the term 'technical debt' refer to?
options: Shortcuts taken in development that require future fixes
questions.correct_answer: Shortcuts taken in development that require future fixes
questions.explanation: Technical debt refers to the cost of fixing shortcuts or suboptimal code in future development.

questions.question_text: Which testing ensures components work together?
questions.explanation: Integration Testing verifies that different modules or components work together correctly.

questions.question_text: What is a prototype in software engineering?
options: A preliminary model of the system
questions.correct_answer: A preliminary model of the system
questions.explanation: A prototype is an early model built to test concepts or gather feedback.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of version control systems?
questions.explanation: Version control systems track and manage changes to source code over time.

questions.question_text: Which document defines the scope of a project?
questions.explanation: The Project Charter outlines the project’s scope, objectives, and stakeholders.

questions.question_text: What is a non-functional requirement?
questions.explanation: Non-functional requirements specify performance criteria like speed, security, or scalability.

questions.question_text: What is the Spiral Model best suited for?
questions.explanation: The Spiral Model is ideal for large, complex projects with risk management focus.

questions.question_text: What does a sequence diagram show?
questions.explanation: Sequence diagrams illustrate how objects interact in a time-based sequence.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of code reviews?
options: To find bugs and improve quality
questions.correct_answer: To find bugs and improve quality
questions.explanation: Code reviews help identify defects and ensure code quality.

questions.question_text: What is software maintenance?
questions.explanation: Maintenance involves updating and fixing software after deployment.

questions.question_text: Which methodology emphasizes customer collaboration?
questions.explanation: Agile emphasizes close collaboration with customers throughout development.

questions.question_text: What is a software architecture?
options: The structure of a system’s components
questions.correct_answer: The structure of a system’s components
questions.explanation: Software architecture defines the structure and organization of a system’s components.

questions.question_text: What is regression testing?
options: Retesting to ensure existing features work
questions.correct_answer: Retesting to ensure existing features work
questions.explanation: Regression testing ensures that new changes haven’t broken existing functionality.

questions.question_text: What is a stakeholder in software engineering?
options: Anyone with an interest in the project
questions.correct_answer: Anyone with an interest in the project
questions.explanation: Stakeholders include anyone affected by or interested in the software project.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a data flow diagram?
options: To model data movement in a system
questions.correct_answer: To model data movement in a system
questions.explanation: Data flow diagrams illustrate how data moves through a system.

questions.question_text: What is a sprint in Agile?
questions.explanation: A sprint is a time-boxed iteration in Agile, typically 2-4 weeks.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a test case?
options: To specify test conditions and expected results
questions.correct_answer: To specify test conditions and expected results
questions.explanation: Test cases define the conditions and expected outcomes for testing.

questions.question_text: What is a software lifecycle?
options: The entire process from planning to retirement
questions.correct_answer: The entire process from planning to retirement
questions.explanation: The software lifecycle covers all phases from planning to retirement.

questions.question_text: What is modularity in software design?
options: Dividing a system into independent modules
questions.correct_answer: Dividing a system into independent modules
questions.explanation: Modularity breaks a system into independent, reusable components.

questions.question_text: What is the V-Model in software engineering?
options: A testing model aligned with development phases
questions.correct_answer: A testing model aligned with development phases
questions.explanation: The V-Model aligns testing phases with development phases for verification and validation.

questions.question_text: What is a risk in software project management?
options: A potential issue that could impact the project
questions.correct_answer: A potential issue that could impact the project
questions.explanation: Risks are potential issues that could negatively affect project outcomes.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a deployment diagram?
options: To model hardware and software distribution
questions.correct_answer: To model hardware and software distribution
questions.explanation: Deployment diagrams show the physical deployment of software on hardware.

questions.question_text: What is refactoring?
options: Improving code structure without changing functionality
questions.correct_answer: Improving code structure without changing functionality
questions.explanation: Refactoring improves code readability and structure without altering its behavior.

questions.question_text: What is a functional requirement?
questions.explanation: Functional requirements specify the specific behaviors or functions of a system.

questions.question_text: What is the role of a product owner in Agile?
questions.explanation: The product owner prioritizes and manages the product backlog in Agile.

questions.question_text: What is a bug in software?
questions.explanation: A bug is a defect in the software that causes it to behave incorrectly.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a Gantt chart?
questions.explanation: A Gantt chart visually represents project tasks and their timelines.

questions.question_text: What is black-box testing?
questions.explanation: Black-box testing focuses on inputs and outputs without knowledge of internal code.

questions.question_text: What is a design pattern?
options: A reusable solution to common problems
questions.correct_answer: A reusable solution to common problems
questions.explanation: Design patterns provide reusable solutions to common software design problems.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a traceability matrix?
questions.explanation: A traceability matrix links requirements to their corresponding deliverables.

questions.question_text: What is acceptance testing?
questions.explanation: Acceptance testing ensures the software meets user requirements and is ready for use.
